original: Berglund, Hadar Erik, professor, rektor, Göteborg, f. 6/3/91 i Sthlm av postexp. E. Wilhelm B. o. Kristina Olsson. G. 18 m. Emma Petersson. Barn: Eskil f. 19, civ:ing., Sthlm, Ann-Mari 31, stud. — Stud:ex. v. nya elem:sk. i Sthlm 09, jur. kand. i Upps. 13, jur. Hc. 20, jur. dr s. å. Res. (m. bidr. fr. jur. fak. i Upps.) t. Danm., Norge o. Tyskl. f. stud. av rätteg :-väsen 23. Tingstjg. 15-17, tjg. v. prot. i Svea hovr. höstsession 17, seikr. i Hvsm:lagst!iftn:komm. 17-23, led. av komm. 22-23, bitr. i just:dep. v. utarb. av försl. t. ändr. i lagen om skiljemän 18, docent i processrätt i Upps. 21, uppeh. m. ena professuren i civ:rätt fören. und :visn :skyldigh. i familjerätt o. sakrätt 22, tf. prof. i processrätt 22-24, docent i rättsvet :skap v. hand :hög-sk. i Gbg 23-29, prof. där 29, rektor sed. 33. Skr.: Om skiljeavtal o. skiljedom (20), Några ord om legalt skil-jemannaförfarande i sv. rätt (21), Stadsbyggn:lagstiftn. o. grannelags-rätt (29), Skiljemän eller »gode män»? (31), Stadsplanebestämmelser, byggn :ordningar o. allm. civ:lag (32), Om nabos lösningsrätt o. andra rätts-förhåll. mellan grannar i stad (34), HandJandes rätteg :förmån (37), Lag-stiftn. mot illojal konkurrens (42), Föreningsjustis i Danmark o. Sverige (42), Svensk medborgares näringsfrihet (44), Das schiedsrichterliche Ver-fahren nach schwedischem Recht (44), Svensk eller främmande lag? (46), Handelsrätt (47), smärre jur. uppsatser, Hand:högsk. i Gbg (33) m. m. RNO, Dansk FrM, LVVS.
translated: Berglund, Hadar Erik, professor, rector, Gothenburg, born March 6, 1891 in Stockholm, son of postman E. Wilhelm B. and Kristina Olsson. Married to Emma Petersson in 1918. Children: Eskil, born 1919, engineering graduate, Stockholm; Ann-Mari, born 1931, student. He passed his student exam at the new elementary school in Stockholm in 1909, law degree at Uppsala in 1913, Licentiate of Law in 1920, and Doctor of Law in the same year. He traveled to Denmark, Norway, and Germany with scholarship from the Faculty of Law in Uppsala to study legal procedure in 1923. He was a court clerk from 1915 to 1917, clerk at the Svea Court of Appeal during the fall session of 1917, legal consultant in the Legislative Commission from 1917 to 1923, member of the commission from 1922 to 1923, assistant in the Ministry of Justice in the drafting of proposed amendments to the Arbitration Law in 1918. He became a Docent of Procedural Law at Uppsala in 1921, held the professorship in Civil Law with a teaching obligation in Family Law and Property Law in 1922, served as temporary professor of Procedural Law from 1922 to 1924, Docent of Legal Theory at the Handelshögskolan in Gothenburg from 1923 to 1929, and Professor at the same university from 1929, serving as rector since 1933. He is the author of several works, including "About Arbitration Agreements and Arbitration Awards" (1920), "Some Words on Legal Arbitration Procedures in Swedish Law" (1921), "City Planning Legislation and Neighboring Rights" (1929), "Arbitrators or 'Good Men'?" (1931), "City Planning Regulations, Building Codes and General Civil Law" (1932), "On Neighbor's Right of Redemption and Other Legal Conditions between Neighbors in the City" (1934), "Rights of Commercial Judicial Privileges" (1937), "Legislation Against Unfair Competition" (1942), "Associational Law in Denmark and Sweden" (1942), "Swedish Citizens' Freedom of Enterprise" (1944), "The Arbitration Procedure under Swedish Law" (1944), "Swedish or Foreign Law?" (1946), "Commercial Law" (1947), several minor legal essays, and others. He was honored with the Royal Norwegian Order of St. Olav, Danish Order of the Dannebrog, and the Finnish Order of the White Rose.

structured.name: Hadar Erik Berglund
structured.description: Hadar Erik Berglund was a Swedish professor and rector at the University of Gothenburg. He was born in Stockholm in 1891 to postman E. Wilhelm Berglund and Kristina Olsson. He married Emma Petersson in 1918 and had two children: Eskil and Ann-Mari. Berglund earned his law degree from Uppsala University in 1913 and later became a docent of Procedural Law at Uppsala. He held several other academic positions before becoming a professor at the University of Gothenburg, where he also served as rector. He is the author of several works in the field of law and was honored with the Royal Norwegian Order of St. Olav, Danish Order of the Dannebrog, and the Finnish Order of the White Rose.
